hints.content:
If we add an exact copy of the triangle, we can make a parallelogram.

Then we can use the parallelogram's area to figure out the triangle's area.

[[☃ image 1]]

The original triangle has $\dfrac{1}{2}$ the area of the parallelogram we just made.

options.alt: A parallelogram. There is a dashed line that is perpendicular to the base from the base to the opposite vertex. An arrow shows the length of the base is labeled 7. The dashed line is labeled 2. The parallelogram has a line segment in diagonal corners that creates two triangles each with a base of 7 units and a height of 2 units.

hints.content: The triangle has an area of $7$ units$^2$.
